Definition: Your task is to read reviews from Amazon and classify them as either Negative or Positive based on their content.

Positive Examples.input: I've read this book with much expectation, it was very boring all through out the book
Positive Examples.explanation: Review writer does not like the book because it was boring, therefore it is a negative review.

Positive Examples.input: I believe I will be very happy with the camcorder. Its small,light and easy to handle.The LCD is clear and bright.Ease of operation.
Positive Examples.explanation: There are positive words in the review like "very happy", "easy to handle", therefore it is a positive review.

Positive Examples.input: love it...very touch.it's to bad that in the dvd description doesn't mention no subtitles
Positive Examples.explanation: There are positive words in the review like "love it", "very touch", therefore it is classified as positive review. Pay attention that although the reviewer is not happy that it's not mentioned that there are no subtitles, the overall polarity of the review is positive.

Negative Examples.input: It starts off a bit slow, but once the product placement jokes start it takes off.
Negative Examples.explanation: This review is positive review since it says that after product placement joke it becomes interesting.

Negative Examples.input: As good as this book may be, the print quality is so bad that I cannot read it. Zero stars would have been more appropriate.
Negative Examples.explanation: This is a negative review. because the print quality of book is very bad and not readable.

Negative Examples.input: I love it, it's LONG and the connection is secure and it doesn't get hot! It's wonderful!
Negative Examples.explanation: This is a positive review because it says "I love it" and "It's wonderful".

I adored these books growing up and the publishers should be ashamed of themselves for changing exactly what made them classics. I would have forgotten about them years ago if it weren't for the haunting illustrations. I took them camping, to slumber parties, they were fantastic and terrifying: which was the whole point. To be scared.I have nothing against the new artist and his work in general, but this is not the place for it. To change what made a book a classic for it's 30th anniversary is insane. I can't imagine what they were thinking.If parents are afraid their kids can't handle these books in their original form, they have simply to not buy them books that are meant to be scary or maybe, you know, flip through the book before you hand it to your child. Which is a sad thing anyway, I've seen nothing good come of raising children in a nerfed world, but still.There is no excuse whatsoever to censor such an eerie, memorable, and nostalgic children's book.

... I just couldn't get into this book. It's a beat classic, so I hear, and it's about traveling and living free and enjoying life on lots of levels. From the descriptions and glowing reviews, I figured I should have loved it. I even read it while I was traveling up the US/Canadian west coast, and I grew up familiar with many of the areas mentioned in the book. In spite of all that, I didn't like it at all. For one thing, it's full of these obscure Buddhist terms and concepts, and although religion is sort of a hobby of mine, I didn't know enough to make sense of all the boddishatva-dropping, and the writing wasn't good enough to make up for that. I guess I just don't like it when the narrator introduces dialogue with "sez I."

One ofthe greatest novels in all of literature, The Scarlet Letter by Nathaniel Hawthorne, tells of a life vastly different from those that we live today. Rejecting the present permissive lifestyle to which we were accustomed, the reader is entrenched in the gloom and doom of Puritan society. It is an exposure to a law that tells what to wear, how to think, and whom to love. The Scarlet Letter is a story of law versus human nature, hypocrisy, and of undeniable passions.Enlightening and refreshing, the reader is taken on an adventure and fully understands the risks of living passionately, beyond the limits that society sets. A novel that can be enjoyed by all ages, The Scarlet Letter is a masterpiece of its time.
